meanings.definition: To speak or perform without preparation
meanings.sent1: She extemporized a speech at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The comedian extemporized jokes during the show.
meanings.sent3: He extemporized a song for his friend's birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The actor extemporized his lines when he forgot the script.
meanings.sent5: The student extemporized a presentation in front of the class.

meanings.definition: To improvise or make up on the spot
meanings.sent1: The chef extemporized a new recipe using leftover ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The musician extemporized a melody during the concert.
meanings.sent3: She extemporized a story to entertain her younger siblings.
meanings.sent4: The artist extemporized a painting inspired by nature.
meanings.sent5: He extemporized a solution to the problem without any prior planning.
